Sentencas: A new model and algorithm for the numerical simulation of multicomponent mass-transfer in solid-oxide fuel-cells (SOFCs) is presented.
Titulo: Multimodal mass transfer in solid-oxide fuel-cells

Sentencas: The model does not neglect any of the possible molecular mass-transfer mechanisms present in a SOFC.
Titulo: Multimodal mass transfer in solid-oxide fuel-cells

Sentencas: It takes into account convection and molecular-diffusion phenomena in the channels, and convection, molecular diffusion and Knudsen diffusion in the porous electrodes.
Titulo: Multimodal mass transfer in solid-oxide fuel-cells

Sentencas: The model does not require any of the constraining hypotheses present in previously published ones.
Titulo: Multimodal mass transfer in solid-oxide fuel-cells

Sentencas: Its noteworthy features are: (i) pressure is not considered as constant (in any direction) in the channel or in the electrode; (ii) global mass transfer through the porous media is modeled by means of the Dusty Gas Model, without any limiting assumption on the number of species in the multicomponent gas mixture; (iii) the physical phenomena in channel and porous medium are coupled through boundary conditions and solved simultaneously; (iv) the model can be used for both the anode and the cathode.
Titulo: Multimodal mass transfer in solid-oxide fuel-cells

Sentencas: The algorithm is designed to simulate multidimensional domains and is applicable to both planar and tubular cells.
Titulo: Multimodal mass transfer in solid-oxide fuel-cells

Sentencas: It has been implemented using OpenFOAM (open field operation and manipulation), an open-source finite-volume-method based CFD-tool.
Titulo: Multimodal mass transfer in solid-oxide fuel-cells

Sentencas: The model performance has been successfully validated by comparison with experimental data reported in the literature for both main types of SOFC, planar and tubular.
Titulo: Multimodal mass transfer in solid-oxide fuel-cells
